channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-156] Add support for a SQOOP action
item.summary: Add support for a SQOOP action

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Same as with the Hive action patch, cannot use reviewboard because OOZIE-610+OOZIE-68 are not committed.

Patch is using Sqoop artifacts from Cloudera Maven repo because Apache Sqoop is not publishing them yet (SQOOP-396)
rebased to latest trunk + OOZIE-68. Not posting in review board because it does not apply as OOZIE-68 is not committed yet (this is becoming a big pain)

-----------------------------------------------------------
This is an automatically generated e-mail. To reply, visit:
https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/
-----------------------------------------------------------

Review request for oozie.

Summary
-------

Adding sqoop action

This addresses bug OOZIE-156.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-156

Diffs

/trunk/src/main/assemblies/sharelib.xml 1208129

Diff: https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/diff

Testing
-------

Similar to the hive action, a special profile must be used to run the sqoop action testcase:

$ mvn clean test -DtestSqoop -Dtest=TestSqoopActionExecutor

Thanks,

Alejandro

<https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/#comment8008>

why move is not supported?

/trunk/core/pom.xml
<https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/#comment8009>

is this the only supported hadoop version? Will it work for any apache version?

<https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/#comment8010>

why does it return hive?

/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/oozie/action/hadoop/SqoopMain.java
<https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/#comment8011>

is it really hive-site.xml ?

/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/oozie/action/hadoop/SqoopMain.java
<https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/#comment8012>

please use try {}finally

{os.close()}

Same thing in multiple places of this file.

/trunk/docs/src/site/twiki/DG_SqoopActionExtension.twiki
<https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/#comment8013>

</sqoop> --></command>

/trunk/docs/src/site/twiki/index.twiki
<https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/#comment8014>

extra line?

  • Mohammad

On 2011-12-01 10:15:41, Mohammad Islam wrote:

> /trunk/client/src/main/resources/sqoop-action-0.2.xsd, line 58

> <https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/diff/1/?file=60676#file60676line58>

>

> why move is not supported?

same as the prepare for all other actions, we are currently not supporting move there.

On 2011-12-01 10:15:41, Mohammad Islam wrote:

> /trunk/core/pom.xml, line 623

> <https://reviews.apache.org/r/2972/diff/1/?file=60677#file60677line623>

>

> is this the only supported hadoop version? Will it work for any apache version?

It will work with an apache version 0.23 onwards.

-----------------------------------------------------------

(Updated 2011-12-01 17:48:00.098530)

Review request for oozie.

Changes
-------

Updated patch based on Mohammad's feedback (thanks).

Removed injection of Hive log config as this is not needed (there was an early attempt of enabling hive table creation, but this sqoop functionality requires an invocation to the hive shell, which is not present in the nodes)

Summary
-------

Adding sqoop action

This addresses bug OOZIE-156.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-156

Diffs (updated)

so for the time being, we have to use this CDH version. 0.20.2XX will not work. right?

Testing

-------

Similar to the hive action, a special profile must be used to run the sqoop action testcase:

$ mvn clean test -DtestSqoop -Dtest=TestSqoopActionExecutor

Thanks,

Alejandro
